Ballyphehane Sustainable Energy Community is the first Cork City community to have prepared an Energy Masterplan, due to be launched in the coming weeks.  Energy efficiencies at their community centre and helping nearby homes to retrofit is the focus of the plan. Very inspiring https://t.co/lYuicRUMv9

The bus is the backbone of our transport system and we're continuing to invest in it: - With BusConnects soon coming to Galway, Limerick & Waterford - Town Bus services for Carlow, Ennis, Letterkenny and Mullingar - And #ConnectingIreland, improving bus provision in rural areas https://t.co/iuSd5kWzrw

This scheme will be community focused, with Community Forums being held in the coming months to help inform the design of the corridors.  For more information on the background of this project and next steps to get involved, you can read more here:  https://t.co/SjXwTNkHeR

The project will also provide high quality segregated cycle lanes, improved walking facilities and an upgraded public realm to make #ActiveTravel an even more attractive mode for as many people as possible  Cork has a unique opportunity to become a leader in sustainable transport https://t.co/QSfN4HAdJg

This project will provide 75km of bus lanes & priority measures on roads into and around Cork City, leading to bus journey times that take almost half the time they currently do  One of the corridors will later be upgraded to provide Cork with its first Luas-style light rail line https://t.co/pvMSTFWvvu

The Framework covers large sections of the energy system and represents all the efforts this government are taking to reduce the impact of this crisis and continue to accelerate our transition away from fossil fuels  Read more here: https://t.co/gKP2JHOdrL

We will also focus on protecting the most vulnerable. Including a package of measures to enhance protections for financially vulnerable and in debt energy customers And a ‚Ç¨20m scheme to install solar panels in households that highly rely on electricity for medical reasons https://t.co/1Owua4rSnL
There will be a continuation of the excise duty reduction on petrol, diesel and marked gas oil until the Budget in October 2022 https://t.co/IuqsBdLo9U

There will be an additional ‚Ç¨100 payment to those in receipt of Fuel Allowance  Public Service Obligation (PSO) levy on electricity bills will be removed.  We will under take a review of the price-drivers behind electricity and natural gas bills (including network costs) https://t.co/efRq7XFcNR
In May, VAT will be reduced from 13.5% to 9% on gas and electricity bills https://t.co/md1BvM6vtl

The Framework sets out the Government‚Äôs action in response to these issues across 3 key themes  1‚É£ Managing the impact with a specific focus on financially vulnerable people 2‚É£ Ensuring security of energy supply in the near term 3‚É£ Reducing our dependency on imported fossil fuels

To learn more about all the ways we're working to enhance and expand public transport, increasing accessibility and efficiency in both urban and rural settings  Take a look at the new National Sustainable Mobility Policy here: https://t.co/6rwV8C5dL0

This enables our buses to begin offering mobile and  contactless card payments, and to explore future technologies so we stay ahead.  It will also enable future fare reductions to be implemented much faster, as well as last minute promotional fares, e.g. Reduced Bank Holidays

The reason for the staged implementation has to do with the complexity involved with updating each ticket machine individually  But, this will become a thing of the past in the near future as the NTA was, in early March, granted approval for their Next Generation Ticketing scheme https://t.co/ytFSIJZroU

From today, fares on @Buseireann and @TFIupdates Local Link PSO routes operating outside the GDA have been reduced by 20%.  This will be followed in early May by 20% off fares across all services in the GDA and 50% off for 19-23 year olds. https://t.co/12fAcQBOiD
